text: I enjoy meaningful conversations and traveling to places with stories. Every person, every street has a narrative — and I'm always curious to listen, reflect, and learn. Tea helps.
Weekends are for exploration — either walking through new neighborhoods or deep-diving into LLM papers and web frameworks. I like to balance curiosity with code, and movement with momentum.
Fun fact: I once spent hours perfecting a portfolio color scheme just to avoid using lavender. Details matter — especially when they affect how users feel about your work.

I'm currently pursuing my MCA at Jadavpur University (CGPA 8.33), following my B.Sc. (Hons.) in Computer Science from WBSU where I ranked 1st with a CGPA of 9.91. I value depth over speed — and curiosity over comfort.
I ranked 2nd in WB-JECA 2024, and held the top rank throughout my B.Sc. semesters. For me, academic success is less about marks and more about mastering what truly matters.

I'm passionate about building intelligent systems with strong foundations — from machine learning and LLM pipelines to web platforms with intuitive UI. I strive to make every product both smart and human-centered.
Proficient in C, C++, Java, SQL, and even 8085 Assembly. I work comfortably across the stack with HTML, CSS, JS, React, Next.js, Tailwind, FastAPI, and tools like Supabase, Git, and Ubuntu.
I value thoughtful developer tools — the kind that improve flow, reduce friction, and elevate experience. For me, great code isn't just functional; it feels right to write.
Debugging excites me. It's like untying a knot — tangled, messy, but immensely rewarding. Especially when the solution turns out to be one elegant, satisfying line.

'Let's Connect!' is an AI-powered platform I built to streamline campus recruitment outreach. It uses LLMs and Streamlit to automate personalized emails, achieving 3x faster outreach with significantly reduced manual effort.

I built a stock price prediction model comparing ReLU and GELU activations in LSTM networks. From pipeline to visualization, the project combined rigorous metrics with clear insights — and a touch of humor.
Star Emporium was my Java GUI project — a digital e-book library aimed at accessibility and eco-efficiency. It blends backend reliability with an intuitive Swing interface for seamless browsing.
I actively contribute to open-source projects — especially in ML and frontend experiments. It's like digital gardening: sharing, refining, and growing solutions that others can build on.
Friends call me the 'team leader' — not just for taking initiative, but for ensuring everyone's voice is heard. Leadership, to me, is about shared goals, not just solo glory.
I believe great teams thrive on communication and clarity. I enjoy leading by example — through vision, trust, and, occasionally, a well-timed meme to lift the mood.
Personalized systems — whether adaptive UIs or context-aware models — inspire me. I love building solutions that feel tailor-made, because impact begins with empathy.
I'm seeking fair compensation aligned with responsibilities and impact. My current priority is to learn, grow, and contribute meaningfully — compensation is part of a larger journey.
I'd love to work on AI systems that solve real-world problems — clean interfaces, open-source models, and solutions that make people's lives easier, one thoughtful interaction at a time.
In 5 years, I see myself building impactful AI tools, mentoring peers, and contributing to open-source communities — ideally from an ergonomic chair, with a loyal dog by my side.
